I'm glad you've booked the day trip to Ayutthaya with Happy Travels agency.

Regarding visa requirements, Thailand has a relatively straightforward process for tourists. Citizens of many countries, including the US, Canada, and most European countries, can enter Thailand without a pre-arranged visa. You'll receive a 30-day tourist visa exemption upon arrival, which is free of charge.

However, there are some exceptions and requirements to be aware of:

* If you plan to stay in Thailand for more than 30 days, you'll need to apply for a tourist visa (single-entry or multiple-entry) before your trip. This can be done through the Royal Thai Embassy or Consulate in your home country or through a visa service.
* If you're traveling from a country that requires a visa, you'll need to apply for one before your trip.
* Some nationalities may require a visa on arrival, which can be obtained at the airport or border crossing.

In your case, since you've already paid a deposit for your trip, I recommend verifying your visa requirements with Happy Travels agency or the Royal Thai Embassy/Consulate in your home country. They can provide guidance on the specific requirements for your nationality and trip duration.

Regarding the visa service recommended by Happy Travels agency, it's likely a convenience service that handles the visa application process for you. While it may be convenient, you can also apply for a visa yourself through the official channels, which might be more cost-effective.

Before making a decision, I recommend checking the official government websites, such as the Royal Thai Embassy or Consulate in your home country, to confirm the visa requirements and fees. This will help you make an informed decision about whether you need a visa and how to obtain one.
